title: 7 baller Airbnbs for business travelers around the globe
text:
pSure, you might find the subcontinent’s fastest Wi-Fi in the Indian tech capital of Bangalore. But the real way to see the country — especially if you’re hoping to get some things done — is to escape the frenzy of the cities. This a href=”https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/670272?s=ItEa” style=”text-decoration:none;”organic farm and hotel/a has a choice of antique-furnished guest rooms, or, for those who like a touch of outdoorsiness but still want marble bathrooms, there’s glamping in airy white tents. Either way, you’ll find plenty to do on work breaks, from hanging out with the farm’s menagerie of cows, goats, chickens, dogs and horses, to socializing over home-cooked communal meals, taking a dip in the pool or riding a camel through the desert. And if you decide you’d rather quit laboring over your laptop and just work on the farm, long-term internships are available./p 
Digital nomads and independent entrepreneurs have been using Airbnb for ages to work on a beach while everyone else suffers in a windowless cube. But now that the home-booking service is making a push to woo corporate travelers, with a new dedicated business-travel platform and a better system for charging company accounts, we’re going to see a lot more briefcases checking in. 
To celebrate that, here’s a selection of baller listings around the world that meet Airbnb’s basic business traveler needs: namely, high-speed Wi-Fi and enviable laptopping perches — so you can make friends back home jealous with Instagram updates like “Office for the day…in paradise. YOLO!” (N.B. friends, please don’t actually write this or I’ll unfollow you and forever look down on you). Because why not clock in from an hacienda in Mexico or an organic farm in India when it’s on the company dime ?
